flow.descriptionCdata:
b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.01cce973-05f0-49cb-b79d-0e17c679425b.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.0d29a537-b5c7-483b-9c2a-8a460220f808.description=This operation runs a SQL command. Inputs\: DBServerName - The hostname or ip address of the database server. DbType - The type of database to connect to. Valid values\: Oracle, MSSQL, Sybase, Netcool, DB2 and Custom. Default value\: Oracle Username - The username to use when connecting to the database. Password - The password to use when connecting to the database. instance - The name instance (for MSSQL Server). Leave it blank for default instance. DbPort - The port to connect to. Default values\: Oracle\: 1521, MSSQL\: 1433, Sybase\: 5000, Netcool\: 4100, DB2\: 50000. Database - The name of the database. authenticationType - The type of authentication used to access the database (applicable only to MSSQL type). Valid values\: sql, windows (for MSSQL) Default value\: sql dbClass - The classname of the JDBC driver to use. dbURL - The url required to load up the driver and make your connection. Command - The command to execute. timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution. When the default value is used, there is no limit on the amount of time allowed for a running command to complete. Default value\: 0 databasePoolingProperties - Properties for database pooling configuration. This parameter replaces the databasePooling.properties file from 9x version (you may copy-paste the file content here). Pooling is disabled by default. For more details check the /Library/Operations/Database/JDBC folder description. Example\: db.pooling.enable\=true resultSetType - the result set type. See JDBC folder description for more details. Valid values\: TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY, TYPE_SCROLL_INSENSITIVE,TYPE_SCROLL_SENSITIVE. Default value\: TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY resultSetConcurrency - the result set concurrency. See JDBC folder description for more details. Valid values\: CONCUR_READ_ONLY, CONCUR_UPDATABLE Default value\: CONCUR_READ_ONLY Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the "Command completed successfully" message if the operation succeeded, or a failure message otherwise. outputText - The return result of SQL command. updateCount - The update count of the command executed. Responses\: success - The command was executed successfully. failure - Failed to execute the command. Note\: 1. Check the JDBC folder description for details on how to load database connectors. 2. In case of using subprograms like (GET_LINE, GET_LINES, NEW_LINE, PUT, PUT_LUNE) from DBMS_OUTPUT package, the DBMS_OUTPUT.ENABLE() declaration should be used before of these calls. b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.32d81e37-d84f-497e-8cd0-74f155ff5fdc.description=This operation runs a SQL command. Leave it blank for default instance. DbPort - The port to connect to. Default values\: Oracle\: 1521, MSSQL\: 1433, Sybase\: 5000, Netcool\: 4100, DB2\: 50000. Valid values\: sql, windows (for MSSQL) Default value\: sql dbClass - The classname of the JDBC driver to use. dbURL - The url required to load up the driver and make your connection. Command - The command to execute. timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution. When the default value is used, there is no limit on the amount of time allowed for a running command to complete. Default value\: 0 databasePoolingProperties - Properties for database pooling configuration. For more details check the /Library/Operations/Database/JDBC folder description. Example\: db.pooling.enable\=true resultSetType - the result set type. See JDBC folder description for more details. In case of using subprograms like (GET_LINE, GET_LINES, NEW_LINE, PUT, PUT_LUNE) from DBMS_OUTPUT package, the DBMS_OUTPUT.ENABLE() declaration should be used before of these calls. b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.4732d8e2-e305-4747-aaf4-a1264a8fb63b.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.67b9f3b9-bd7a-4ce6-902e-0b36f1f6b0cf.description=
Schedule Flow - Schedules a flow or updates an existing schedule of a flow.

Inputs\:
    host - The target host for your request. The host can also be given as a URL.
    username - The username to use when connecting to the Central service.
    password - The password to use when connecting to the Central service.
    port - The port the Central service is running on.
Default value\: 8080.
    protocol - The protocol used to communicate to the Central service.
Default value\: http
Valid values\: http, https.
    trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: false.
Valid values\: true, false.
    trustKeystore - The path of the truststore file. It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
    trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore. Provide this input only if trustKeystore is not empty.
    flow - The UUID or the path of the flow to run. When dealing with CloudSlang flows this input accepts also a flow namespace.
Example\: /Library/Integrations/Amazon/S3/Buckets/Enumerate Buckets
    schedule - The id of the schedule to update.
    names - A delimiter separated list of names of flow inputs.
    values - A delimiter separated list of values of flow inputs.
    delimiter - The delimiter separating lists of names and values.
Default value\: , (comma).
    description - A description of this schedule. If this input is set then the provided value will be the "Schedule Name" in Central/Run Management/Scheduler and after the execution of the scheduled flow will appear as "Run Name" in Central/Run Management/Run Explorer. 
Example\: "Scheduled Flow Created By ..."
    enabled - Set false to create the schedule disabled. This input is case insensitive.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: true.
    startTime - The time to start running the flow either as minutes from now or as a date. Use the utility operations from "Date and Time" folder to pass valid startTime value.
Example\: Wed, 12 Dec 2012 12\:12\:12 GMT
Example\: Wed, 12 Dec 2012 12\:12\:12 GMT+0430 (4 hours, 30 minutes west of the Greenwich meridian).
    endTime - The time to end running the flow either as minutes from now or as a date. Use the utility operations from "Date and Time" folder to pass valid endTime value.
Example\: Wed, 12 Dec 2012 12\:12\:12 GMT
Example\: Wed, 12 Dec 2012 12\:12\:12 GMT+0430 (4 hours, 30 minutes west of the Greenwich meridian).
    timesToRun - The number of times to re-run the flow schedule. If empty, the number of times to re-run the schedule will be computed as (endTime - startTime)/repeatInterval. If -1 the flow will be scheduled to run indefinitely, otherwise this input must have a positive value.
    repeatInterval - Sets the time interval in minutes between schedule triggering. If empty, the operation will set it to 1 minute.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Thi is the primary output. The id of the schedule.
    flowUuid - The UUID of the flow. This can be useful if the flow input is the path of the flow.

Responses\:
    success - The schedule was created or updated.
    failure - Could not connect to central web service. Invalid inputs. Invalid flow path. The schedule ends before it starts. The schedule ends in the past.

Notes\:
1. "timesToRun" and "endTime" inputs are mutually exclusive.
2. If the operation is used to update a flow schedule, only the values for the following fields can be updated\: "startTime", "endTime", "timesToRun", "repeatInterval", "names" and "values".
b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.96710bc5-3cad-4121-af41-eb10c4f8e692.callout=This flow is designed to be ran on a scheduler once per day. It will query an external DB/CMDB for OSIs that have a Patching Window within the next 24 hours. Then, it will optinally open a change for that patching on that OSI and set it up in HPOO Scheduler b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.a4c57c28-5de6-475e-9e0e-deaa4ffe0c8f.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.b054733e-9f7c-4e89-89ef-4021a27acca7.description=
This operation is used to send a smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true. 
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A delimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    headers - This input contains extra headers you want to be added in the mail. The input has a 'Map' format. Header names are separated from header values through a column delimiter and headers will be separated between them by a row delimiter.
Example\:
    Sensitivity\:Company-Confidential
    message-type\:Multiple Part
    Sensitivity\:Personal
In the above example, the columnDelimiter is "\:" and the rowDelimiter is the new line. You can define multiple values for the same header like in the example above. The delimiters can have multiple characters, but be careful that the rowDelimiter is not a substring of the columnDelimiter.
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter that separates headers in the 'headers' input.
Default value\: "\:"
Examples\: '|', '\='
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates the header name from header value on the same row.
Default value\: "\n"	
Examples\: ';', '\#'
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - If SMTP authentication is needed, the password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32, EUC-JP, ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, Windows-31J.
Default value\: UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: quoted-printable, base64, 7bit, 8bit, binary, x-token.
Default value\: quoted-printable (or Q Encoding).
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
Default value\: ','
    encryptionKeystore - The path to the pks12 formatted keystore used to encrypt the mail.
    encryptionKeyAlias - The alias of a RSA key pair from the encryptionKeystore. The public key from the pair will be used to encrypt the mail. The key pair must not have password. The recommended key size is 2048 bit or higher.
    encryptionKeystorePassword - The password for the encryptionKeystore.
    encryptionAlgorithm - The encryption algorithm applied on the key from the keystore in order to encypt email parts. 
Default value\: AES256_CBC.
Valid values\: DES_EDE3_CBC, RC2_CBC, IDEA_CBC, CAST5_CBC, AES128_CBC, AES192_CBC, AES256_CBC, CAMELLIA128_CBC, CAMELLIA192_CBC, CAMELLIA256_CBC, SEED_CBC, DES_EDE3_WRAP, AES128_WRAP, AES256_WRAP, CAMELLIA128_WRAP, CAMELLIA192_WRAP, CAMELLIA256_WRAP, SEED_WRAP.
    enableTLS - Enables starttls. If the server supports TLS or SSL, the communications will be secured by TLS or SSL. If it doesn't support TLS or SSL the communication will be unsecure.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for sending the mail message.

Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
3. You can use KeyStore Explorer to obtain RSA Keystore with keyPairs for encryption/decryption.
    3.1 If you get "llegal key size exception" you don't have JCE Unlimited Strength installed.
b1381750-5eb7-4721-aa4b-9edbf8b9c196.f3efaea6-56d0-4a7d-8618-97e495395d80.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:

    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
flow.name: dailyPatchForecast

staticBinding.value: Daily Patch Forecast/Scheduling For Next 24 Hours

${dailyForecastResultHTML}
Patching Forecast/Schedule For Next 24 Hours
ServerName Service Request
 Server Owner
 Scheduled Patching Time

step.name: Get All Servers To Be Patched Today

staticBinding.value: INSERT INTO patchingdashboard (ServerName,ChangeRequest,StartTime,Owner,Platform,PatchingStep,PatchingStatus) VALUES ('${currentServerName}','${serviceRequestID}','${currentPatchMonth} ${currentPatchDay}, ${currentPatchYear} ${currentPatchTimeNoGMT}','${currentServerOwner}','','','Scheduled')
The following servers will be patched through automation with the latest approved InfoSec patch sets ${serverNameListTotal}
